### Intro
Welcome to section three.  
This section begins the discussion of Fundamental Analysis, a powerful topic used to evaluate the fair-value and future movement of a stock.  

Fundamental Analysis is an extremely important topic, and it is used all the time to make quality trades.

  </div>

  <div id="step2" style="display: none;">
### Defined
Fundamental Analysis is the research into a company's financial state, growth, and earnings. It additionally dives into a company's qualitative features (quality), including insider-trading, moat, and other intrinsic data.  

  </div>

  <div id="step3" style="display: none;">
<!-- cont --> 
But at its core, Fundamental Analysis uses inherent/intrinsic factors to measure a stock's fair value and its future momentum.

  </div>

  <div id="step4" style="display: none;">
<!-- cont --> 
### Words/Terms to Start With
<span class = "smalltext-black">To fully understand Fundamental Analysis, you must understand some basic terms that will be widely used later on.</span>

**Revenue:**  The total income generated by the company  
**Net-Income:**  The amount of money made after subtracting all expenses, <span class = "smalltext-black">(same as "profit", but is referred to net-income in the stock market)</span>  
**EPS:**  EPS stands for earnings-per-share. It can be taken by dividing the net-income by the number of total shares outstanding, <span class = "smalltext-black">(NetIncome / SharesOutstanding)</span>  
 - EPS is an extremely important factor within Fundamental Analysis, and we will use it greatly for checking company growth and potential.  

  </div>

  <div id="step5" style="display: none;">
### Earnings Reports
Earnings reports are one of the highlights of Fundamental Analysis.  

Every ~3 months, a company of the stock market must release a financial report detailing their financial state and numbers.

These reports contain troves of information about a company and its wellbeing.

  </div>

<script>
document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {
  var currentStep = 1;
  var totalSteps = 25; // Total number of steps

  document.getElementById("nextButton").addEventListener("click", function() {
    var nextStep = document.getElementById("step" + (currentStep + 1));
    if (nextStep) {
      nextStep.style.display = "block";
      currentStep++;
    }
    this.parentNode.insertBefore(this, document.getElementById("step" + currentStep).nextSibling);
    if (currentStep === totalSteps) {
      this.remove(); // Remove the "Next" button after the last step
    }
  });
});
</script>
